topic.title: Boost Your Remote Sensing Expertise – Register for Advanced Remote Sensing (GEO4938/GEO6038)!
topic.text:
Hi everyone,

I want to let you know about an excellent opportunity to further develop your remote sensing skills this Fall semester: Advanced Remote Sensing (GEO4938/GEO6038).

This course takes your remote sensing knowledge to the next level by focusing on cutting-edge Earth observation technologies, including:

LiDAR: Analyze 3D point clouds, terrain modeling, and forest structure.

Hyperspectral Imaging: Advanced techniques in spectral unmixing and ecosystem analysis.

Time Series Analysis: Multi-temporal change detection, phenological cycle modeling, and environmental monitoring.

The course is taught by Dr. Di Yang and is designed to provide extensive hands-on experience with airborne and terrestrial data, sophisticated analytical techniques, and practical projects.

Additionally, this class counts as an elective towards your Geospatial Information Analyst Certificate, making it a smart choice to advance both your skills and credentials.

Course Details:

Semester: Fall 2025

Location: Turlington Hall 3006

Instructor: Dr. Di Yang

Prerequisites: None

Seats may fill quickly, so I encourage you to register soon!

Feel free to reach out if you have questions or need more information.

Best,
Dr. Sounny
